payload.message:
Morning brief time. Do the following:
1. Check all configured Jira boards for: overdue tickets, tickets due this week, in-progress tickets with no recent updates (48h+), and any high-priority items.
2. Check recent GitHub activity on tracked repos ‚Äî any overnight PRs merged, CI failures, deploys.
3. Pull top 3 most urgent action items.
4. Check memory for yesterday's notes for continuity.
5. Deliver a concise morning brief via Telegram in this format:

‚òÄÔ∏è Morning Brief ‚Äî [Day Date]

üî¥ Top Priority Today
1. [Most urgent item + due date]
2. [Second]
3. [Third]

‚ö†Ô∏è Blockers
- [Blocked tickets or stale items]

üìÖ Due This Week
- [Tickets due in next 5 days]

Keep it under 300 words. Lead with what needs action today.

6. For each finding (blockers, task updates, insights), call engie_observe with the appropriate type, summary, and tags (e.g. ticket IDs). This stores structured data in memory for future context.

Afternoon follow-up. Check for any new Jira updates since this morning. If workspace/HANDOFF.md exists and has pending work, continue it. For each status change or finding, call engie_observe with the appropriate type (task_update, blocker, insight), a concise summary, and relevant tags (ticket IDs). This stores structured data in memory for future context.

Check if /Users/grantjwylie/.openclaw/workspace/research/DONE.md exists. If it does, read research/overnight-report.md and research/anthropic-job-hunt.md and send J a Telegram message. Format:

üî¨ Overnight Research Ready

üéØ Anthropic Path ‚Äî Top Actions
[Top 3 most actionable concrete steps from anthropic-job-hunt.md]

üìä Project Market Analysis
[1-2 sentence summary per project from overnight-report.md]

üìÅ Full reports in workspace/research/

If DONE.md does NOT exist, send: ‚è≥ Research still running ‚Äî full report coming in morning brief.

jobs.name: Devops Thread Monitor ‚Äî Patient Portal Blockers

payload.message:
Check Slack thread for new replies. Channel: C05LSEMPMDG, thread_ts: 1771529551.687709. This is a thread in #devops asking about patient portal blockers (PR #483, AD-1205, AD-1206).

1. Call slack_get_thread_replies for channel C05LSEMPMDG thread 1771529551.687709
2. Count the replies. The thread was created with 2 bot messages (the original post + a links reply). Any messages beyond those 2 are new human replies.
3. If there are new replies, send Grant a Telegram message with the content:

üì¨ New reply in #devops patient portal thread

[Quote each new reply with the author and text]

If no new replies, do nothing ‚Äî no Telegram message needed.

IMPORTANT: This is a temporary monitor. Once all 3 items (PR #483 merged, AD-1205 done, AD-1206 done) are resolved, disable this job by noting it in your response.

Check Slack thread for new replies. Channel: C0A7KA6RUQN, thread_ts: 1771529993.026749. This is a thread in #tech-hos-works asking the Amatya team to review hos-portal-api PRs #19 and #20 for the patient portal.

1. Call slack_get_thread_replies for channel C0A7KA6RUQN thread 1771529993.026749
2. Count the replies. The thread was created with 1 bot message (the original post). Any messages beyond that 1 are new human replies.
3. If there are new replies, send Grant a Telegram message with the content:

üì¨ New reply in #tech-hos-works patient portal PR review thread

[Quote each new reply with the author and text]

If no new replies, do nothing ‚Äî no Telegram message needed.

IMPORTANT: This is a temporary monitor. Once both PRs (#19 and #20) are reviewed/merged, disable this job by noting it in your response.

Forge nightly training check. Run this sequence:

1. Read the forge DB stats by running: bun -e 'import { getForgeStats } from "/Users/grantjwylie/engie/trainer/forge-db.js"; console.log(JSON.stringify(getForgeStats()));'
2. Check if unusedPairs >= 50. If not, report 'Not enough new pairs for training (N unused)' via Telegram and stop.
3. If >= 50 pairs, FIRST unload all Ollama models to free VRAM:
   curl -s http://localhost:11434/api/generate -d '{"model":"engie-coder:latest","keep_alive":0}'
   curl -s http://localhost:11434/api/generate -d '{"model":"llama3.2","keep_alive":0}'
   curl -s http://localhost:11434/api/generate -d '{"model":"llama3.1","keep_alive":0}'
4. Run the full training pipeline:
   a. cd ~/engie/trainer && .venv/bin/python scripts/prepare-data.py
   b. .venv/bin/python scripts/train.py
   c. .venv/bin/python scripts/evaluate.py
   d. .venv/bin/python scripts/fuse-and-deploy.py
5. After deploy, run self-iterate benchmark to collect new training traces:
   bun ~/engie/trainer/self-iterate.mjs --model engie-coder:latest
6. Send a Telegram summary:

Forge Nightly Training Complete
Training: Version [version], Train loss [loss], [count] examples
Benchmark: Overall [score]%, Change [+/-delta] vs previous
Self-Iterate: [passed]/[total] tasks
Model: engie-coder:[version] deployed

If any step fails, report the error and which step failed via Telegram.

Forge weekly report. Compile a comprehensive training status:

1. Read forge DB stats: bun -e 'import { getForgeStats, getAllVersions, getAllRuns, getAllEvaluations } from "/Users/grantjwylie/engie/trainer/forge-db.js"; console.log(JSON.stringify({ stats: getForgeStats(), versions: getAllVersions(), runs: getAllRuns(), evals: getAllEvaluations() }));'
2. Run a fresh benchmark: cd ~/engie/trainer && .venv/bin/python scripts/evaluate.py
3. Send a Telegram report:

üìä Forge Weekly Report

üóÇÔ∏è Data Collection
- Total pairs: [N]
- This week: [N new]
- Categories: [breakdown]

üèãÔ∏è Training History
- Total runs: [N]
- Latest: [version] ([date])
- Best benchmark: [score]%

üìà Improvement Trend
[Version history with scores]

üéØ Router Threshold
- Current: [threshold]
- Tasks routed to local: [%]

üí° Recommendations
[Suggest if more data needed, if threshold should adjust, etc.]

Keep it under 500 words.

state.lastError: Error: cron: job execution timed out

jobs.name: Deploy Thread Monitor ‚Äî hos-portal-api dev redeploy

payload.message:
Check Slack thread for new replies. Channel: C06FA42E8SK, thread_ts: 1771617837.420859. This is a thread in #tech-hos-deploy requesting a dev redeploy of hos-portal-api.

1. Call slack_get_thread_replies for channel C06FA42E8SK thread 1771617837.420859
2. The original message is the only one so far. Any additional messages are new replies.
3. If there are new replies, send Grant a Telegram message:

üì¨ Reply in #tech-hos-deploy (hos-portal-api redeploy)

[Quote each new reply with the author and text]

4. If someone confirms the deploy is done, note it in your response and this job can be disabled.

If no new replies, do nothing ‚Äî no Telegram message needed.
